channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China to Force Authors to Provide Real Names When Publishing Online
item.description: Linking the offline identities of authors with their online writings, new guidelines say, will encourage writers to “better take responsibility” for their works as well as strengthen their “professional moral education and training.”
item.category: State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television (China)
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN
item.media:credit: Shiho Fukada for The New York Times
item.media:description: Hao Qun, known to most readers as Murong Xuecun, is one of many prominent Chinese writers to use a pen name.

item.title: After Victory at Greek Polls, Leftist Politician Forms Coalition Government
item.description: Alexis Tsipras created the government with a right-wing fringe party that will charge immediately into the task of reversing wrenching austerity policies.
item.dc:creator: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JIM YARDLEY
item.media:description: After his left-wing Syriza party won a decisive victory in national elections on Sunday, Alexis Tsipras, right, met with Panos Kammenos, the leader of the Independent Greeks, on Monday as part of an effort to form a coalition government.

item.title: Prank Caller Pulls Wool Over British Surveillance Agency’s Eyes
item.description: A prankster secured a private cellphone number for a top intelligence chief and apparently made a separate phone call to the prime minister in his name, British officials acknowledged.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL
item.media:credit: Gchq/British Ministry of Defence, via European Pressphoto Agency
item.media:description: The Government Communications Headquarters in Britain fell victim to a prank call.

item.title: Despite Initial Tremors, Markets Mostly Shake Off Greek Election Results
item.description: Recent polls showed an anti-austerity party was likely to win the elections, and investors on Monday appeared to take the results in stride.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID JOLLY and NEIL GOUGH

item.title: Small Drone Is Found on White House Grounds
item.description: Josh Earnest, the press secretary, said he did not have details about the size or type of the drone, but he said the Secret Service was investigating.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Small Drone Is Found on White House Grounds
item.description: Josh Earnest, the press secretary, said he did not have details about the size or type of the drone, but he said the Secret Service was investigating.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Scores of Philippine Police Officers Killed in Firefight With Rebels
item.description: The officers were killed during an attempt to capture one of Southeast Asia’s most wanted terrorism suspects, police and government officials said.
item.dc:creator: By FLOYD WHALEY

item.title: After Victory at Greek Polls, Leftist Politician Begins Coalition Talks
item.description: Alexis Tsipras, who swept to power on Sunday, entered discussions on Monday morning to form a coalition government that would determine how his Syriza party will start to reverse wrenching austerity policies.
item.dc:creator: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JIM YARDLEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong Editor, Attacked Last Year, Expresses Hope for Future of News Media
item.description: Kevin Lau Chun-to, still using crutches and hobbling almost a year after he was attacked with a cleaver, said closer ties with mainland China came with great risks, but expressed hope for press freedom.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Kevin Lau Chun-to in January 2014, after his dismissal as editor of the Hong Kong newspaper Ming Pao.

item.title: Obama Makes the Most of India’s Republic Day Parade
item.description: President Obama, in the seat of the chief guest at the New Delhi parade, used his visit to cement stronger relations between the United States and India.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER and ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: President Obama sitting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India at the Republic Day parade in New Delhi on Monday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Officials Accused of Dining on Endangered Salamander
item.description: A group of Chinese officials who were said to have assaulted a reporter who intruded on their luxury meal had been eating endangered giant salamander, a Chinese newspaper reported.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Giant salamanders for sale at a restaurant in Wenzhou, in the coastal province of Zhejiang.

item.title: World Briefing: Malaysia: Airline Website Is Hacked
item.description: Malaysia Airlines’s website has been hacked by a group that posted a message proclaiming support for the Islamic State militant group.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Film Highlights Air Pollution’s Broad Reach
item.description: “Smog Journeys” follows the lives of two Chinese families: one a mining family in rural Hebei Province and the other a cosmopolitan family in hyper-urban Beijing.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN
item.media:description: A steel plant in the Handan area of Hebei Province, south of Beijing. A new film tries to show that all Chinese, regardless of socioeconomic status or geography, are affected by dirty air.

item.title: Saudis Expand Regional Power as Others Falter
item.description: Rather than undermine the Saudi dynasty, the chaos across the region after the Arab Spring revolts appears instead to have lifted the monarchy to unrivaled power and influence.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, left, the president of Egypt, with King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia in June. The king, who died last week, gave Egypt $12 billion in assistance after Mr. Sisi came to power.

item.title: Disillusioned by War, Israeli Soldiers Muted in 1967 Are Given Fuller Voice
item.description: As the International Criminal Court considers a war crimes investigation in the recent Gaza conflict, a new documentary film is showcasing previously unaired accounts of the brutal experiences of an earlier generation of Israeli soldiers.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Mor Loushy, director of "Censored Voices," a new film about the 1967 war.

item.title: At Least 18 Die in Egyptian Violence
item.description: The deaths came on the fourth anniversary of the Arab Spring uprising, a reminder of the ruthless crackdown the military-backed government has used to silence any echoes of that revolt.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Shaimaa al-Sabbagh receiving assistance after she was shot in clashes with the police in Cairo on Saturday. She later died.

item.title: W.H.O. Members Endorse Resolution to Improve Response to Health Emergencies
item.description: Key provisions include creating a global cadre of emergency health workers, establishing a fund that could be tapped quickly, and support for the development of treatments for emerging infectious diseases.
item.dc:creator: By SHERI FINK

item.title: The Vatican Switches to Balloons for Peace
item.description: Balloons, not doves, were released as a gesture of peace on Sunday in St. Peter’s Square, a year after an attack by a gull and a crow on the symbolic birds set off protests by animal protection groups.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Memo From Dresden: German Quandary of How to Deal With Anti-Immigration Movement
item.description: Local leaders have started engaging with supporters of the movement, despite concerns about its roots and backing from neo-Nazis and extremists.
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY
item.media:description: A rally Sunday by the Patriotic Europeans Against the Islamization of the West, known as Pegida, drew thousands in Dresden, where the movement has grown.

item.title: Obama Clears a Hurdle to Better Ties With India
item.description: President Obama came to an agreement with Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India on nuclear energy, renewed a 10-year defense pact, agreed to joint military hardware production and resolved to work with India to reduce the threat of greenhouse gas emissions.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER and ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: Mr. Obama and Michelle Obama greeting guests before dinner ceremonies hosted by President Pranab Mukherjee, left.
